alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued November 27 at 2:31AM PST until November 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet with dangerous rip currents through mid morning, then surf will subside to 5 to 8 feet. Minor tidal overflow and coastal flooding possible around the time of the morning high tide. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor coastal flooding is possible near the time of high tide this morning. The high tide will be at 851 AM PST, with a height between 6.7 and 7.2 feet. Surf will be highest on west and northwest facing beaches.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly locations in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
